data.title: ePremier League Preview
data.meta_description: Everything you need to know about this weekend's ePremier League Grand Finals.
data.text:
This season's ePremier League reaches its conclusion this weekend, when 40 EA SPORTS FC players, representing all 20 Premier League clubs, battle to be crowned 2023/24 ePremier League Champions.

The Grand Finals, which will take place on March 23rd and 24th, will see the 16 clubs who were unable to qualify for the quarter-finals during January's group stage attempt to secure their spot alongside Manchester City, Liverpool FC, Brighton & Hove Albion, and Luton Town.

Out of those 16 clubs competing on Saturday, four will join those teams for the climax of the tournament on Sunday, when the quarter-finals, semi-finals, and the Grand Final will take place at Elstree Studios in London.

Here's everything you need to know about this weekend's tournament:

How to watch

Fans across the world will be able to catch all of the action across the Premier League's digital channels, including YouTube, X, Facebook, TikTok and the Premier League website and app.

It will also be streamed across the EA SPORTS FC Pro Twitch Channel, with viewers able to watch on Sky Sports and TNT Sports in the UK as well.

ePremier League Participants

This weekend's event will feature some incredible FC Pro players who will all be vying for a spot in the upcoming eChampions League, the FC Pro World Championship and a share of the Â£100,000 prize pool. Here's the list of competitors:

Knockout Stage Teams

Viewership and In-Game Rewards

Fans who tune into this weekend's tournament can also receive rewards for doing so. To obtain these rewards, make sure your EA account is linked to your Twitch or YouTube account. Check out the list of rewards below:
